heading: contributors
subheading: wagner james au (wjamesau@well.com) hosts the well’s screenwriters’ conference. ivan berger has been a gadget lover since kindergarten, an audio enthusiast since high school, and technical editor of audio magazine since 1982. jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine. eric demby writes about music and new york city and is the music […]
author: wired staff
text: wagner james au (wjamesau@well.com) hosts the well's screenwriters' conference.ivan berger has been a gadget lover since kindergarten, an audio enthusiast since high school, and technical editor of audio magazine since 1982.jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine.eric demby writes about music and new york city and is the music editor at paper.karen eng (aerodeliria@hotmail.com) is still wondering where her next meal is coming from.denis faye is an expat writer living in melbourne, australia, where he doesn't get enough surf or good mexican food.simson garfinkel is the author of architects of the information society: 35 years of the laboratory for computer science at mit, published this september by mit press.chris hudak is a freelance writer and marginal japanese-language student.clare kleinedler is editor of audiocafe.com.andrew leonard is senior technology correspondent for salon.com.sally mcgrane is a technology and food writer in san francisco. she has written about technology for wired, the new york times, and forbes asap.scott mckim (smckim@hollywoodreporter.com) is an editor at the hollywood reporter.mitch myers (comeback@mcs.com) is a psychologist and a freelance writer. he lives in chicago and manhattan and spends a lot of time on the phone.tamara palmer is co-editor of urb and currently transmits to amazon.com, cdnow, and flaunt from san francisco.carol queen is a worker/owner at good vibrations, writes a monthly column for playboy online, and is the author of real live nude girl.james rozzi (rozzi1625@aol.com) lives in atlanta, where he's a musician, teacher, and writer for a local jazz column.tony scherman's backbeat: earl palmer's story was recently published by smithsonian institution press.dean suzuki teaches music history at san francisco state university and is a programmer at kpfa in berkeley, california.norman weinstein (nweinste@micron.net) is a widely published poet and critic who writes scripts for wgbh radio's sound & spirit series.got an idea for street cred? email street crednetwork in a cablevirtual velvet undergrounddangerous beautyglobopopbuying timeholy
